Center for Brooklyn History
Faithe Weisblatt school materials collection
Weisblatt, Faithe
Thomas Jefferson High School (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
P.S. 184 (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
J.H.S. 109 (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
CBHM.0015
0.25 Linear Feet in one half size manuscript box
1939-1948 Certificates and diplomas, report cards, publications and ephemera relating to Faithe Weisblatt and her attendance at three Brooklyn schools from 1939-1948: P.S. 184, J.H.S. 109 Straus, and Thomas Jefferson High School.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
These materials were found-in-collection in the Brooklyn Collection morgue and their source is unknown.
Arrangement
The materials are arranged by institution.
Biographical note
Faithe Weisblatt attended P.S. 184 from approximately 1939-1942, J.H.S. 109 Straus from approximately 1943-1945, and Thomas Jefferson High School from approximately 1945-1948. She lived at 133 Powell Street in Brownsville.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
If digital surrogates exist, they should be used in place of the originals whenever possible.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Faithe Weisblatt school materials collection, CBHM.0015, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.
Processing Information
This material was found-in-collection and was originally going to be added to the Brooklyn schools collection (CBHM.0006). The archivist determined that these materials should be maintained as a standalone collection since they all relate to a single student.
Related Materials
Brooklyn schools collection (CBHM.0006)
Brooklyn yearbooks collection (BCMS.0031)
Brooklyn high school newspaper collection (BCMS.0030)
Content Description
A collection of materials relating to Faithe Weisblatt and her attendance at three Brooklyn schools from 1939-1948: P.S. 184, J.H.S. 109 Straus, and Thomas Jefferson High School. Includes certificates and diplomas, report cards, publications and ephemera. The collection also includes one undated publication from a camp, the Madisonian, of which Weisblatt was editor-in-chief.
Conditions Governing Use
While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
